Urgent 'solar storm' warning as giant sunspot threatens mass power cutsThe sunspot AR3664, stretching 124,000 miles-wide, has released intense bursts of energy and radiation in the direction of Earth.

Donald Trump gets own son Barron’s age wrong‘He’s pretty young, I will say. He’s 17,’ said the former president of his 18-year-old son

Florida sheriff releases bodycam of fatal police shooting of Black US airman at homeThe Okaloosa County Sheriff’s Office has denied family allegation that deputy involved in shootingwent to the wrong apartment

Watch live as Donald Trump’s hush money trial continues after fiery testimony from Stormy DanielsWarning: This livestream has not been independently fact-checked and may contain misinformation.

Stormy Daniels hits out at Trump by saying ‘real men’ respond to testimony by taking the standIt is currently unclear whether Mr Trump will testify as part of his defense at hush money trial

Pope calls for Italians to have more babies as birthrate drops across EuropePremier Giorgia Meloni has mounted a campaign to encourage at least 500,000 births annually by 2033
-
Putin reappoints same prime minister following Russia’s sham electionPutin praises Mikhail Mishustin for keeping Russian economy afloat despite his damaging war on Ukraine and subsequent Western sanctions
-
Meet the man dubbed 'next Gandhi' hoping to oust Narendra Modi in India's electionANALYSIS: The electoral fate of either Narendra Modi or Rahul Gandhi will decide vastly different Indian paths, writes senior research fellow Antonia Filmer.
-
Virginia school board votes to restore Confederate names after bitter debateShenandoah County School Board voted five to one in favour of reinstating the original names of two schools
-
Police search after man slashed in face during fight in Perth shopping centrePolice remain at the scene at Carousel Shopping Centre
-
Israel-Gaza latest: UN warns aid operations to run out in days as Netanyahu vows to carry out Rafah attackThe US has suspended at least one weapons shipment to Israel over concerns about their potential harm to civilians. They are now considering suspending further transfers
-
Russia launches fresh invasion as 'saboteurs' storm over Ukraine's borderRussian social media channels have exploded claiming attacks in Ukraine's Kharkiv region taking cities while the regional governor dismissed the assault as raids by "saboteurs".
-
For Israel’s contestant, the Eurovision Song Contest comes with tight security, boos and cheersEden Golan is in Sweden for the Eurovision Song Contest, but she is not seeing much of the country
-
Israel resolutely vows to 'stand alone' as Benjamin Netanyahu fumes over Joe Biden threatPresident Biden recently announced that he would not supply weapons to Israel if they invaded the city of Rafah.
-
Trump trial live: Hush money case to resume after Stormy Daniels taunts former president with ‘real men’ tweetAdult film actress concludes testimony after firmly refuting alleged inconsistencies in her account of the sexual encounter she claims she had with the former president in a Lake Tahoe hotel room in July 2006
-
China tensions explode as Beijing intercepts 'trespassing' US Destroyer in South China SeaChina's Southern Command claimed to have intercepted a US Destroyer in the South China Sea, claimed by Beijing, that it accused of "trespassing".
-
Pro-Palestinian student protesters clash with police in AmsterdamPro-Palestine students and activists clashed with riot police during a demonstration in Amsterdam on Thursday evening (9 May).
-
Boeing 737 forced into emergency landing minutes after take-off in latest safety incidentIn the fourth incident to hit the embattled aircraft manufacturer, a Boeing 737 was forced to make an emergency landing just minutes after taking off.
-
UN General Assembly set to back Palestine’s bid for membershipUS representative says Biden administration, a close Israeli ally, is opposed to the resolution
-
Israel-Gaza latest: Netanyahu vows Israel can ‘stand alone’ as he defies US threat to curb arms over RafahThe US has suspended at least one weapons shipment to Israel over concerns about their potential harm to civilians. They are now considering suspending further transfers
-
Vladimir Putin lashes out at 'arrogant' West in chilling warning as WW3 fears explodeVladimir Putin made the comments as he celebrated the 79th anniversary of the Soviet Union's victory over Germany in World War II this week.
-
ISIS terrorists carry out 'major attack' with jihadists storming cityIslamic State terrorists have carried out a "large scale attack" taking over a city amid fears the jihadist group is making a resurgence.
-
Huge ‘golf ball-sized’ hailstones pelt Tennessee as strong storms kill at least two peopleLarge hail pelted parts of Tennessee on Wednesday 8 May, as strong storms slammed the state killing at least 2 people.
-
Trump trial live: Trump’s mistrial and gag order motions denied after dramatic Stormy Daniels testimonyAdult film actress concludes testimony after firmly refuting alleged inconsistencies in her account of the sexual encounter she claims she had with the former president in a Lake Tahoe hotel room in July 2006
-
Vladimir Putin unleashes hell as brutal drone attack rocks key Ukrainian cityRussian forces launched a mass drone attack on Ukraine overnight leaving two people injured and homes destroyed.
-
Volodymyr Zelensky fires Ukraine security chief after foiled assassination plot revealedUkrainian President Zelensky has just fired his country's head of security, but did not provide specific reasons for the termination.
-
Watch live view of camp for displaced Palestinians in Rafah as Israeli strikes intensifyWatch a live view from a camp for displaced people in Rafah on Friday 10 May.
-
Putin crisis after NATO issues 'red lines' warning as West braces for WW3 with RussiaEXCLUSIVE: Russian-sponsored terror campaigns targeting NATO countries could theoretically be seen as acts of war, raising the question of what would be an appropriate response by the West.
-
Netanyahu defies ally Joe Biden and says Israel will ‘fight with fingernails’ if US stops arms suppliesIsraeli prime minister vows again to go ahead with ground offensive in Rafah, where over 1.3 million Palestinians are sheltering
-
Pro-Palestinian protesters demand endowment transparency. But its proving not to be simpleSome universities are vowing to provide information about how much university endowment money is invested in companies profiting from the Israel-Hamas war amid calls from pro-Palestinian protesters
